channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CASSANDRA-9124] GCInspector logs very different times after CASSANDRA-7638
item.description:
After the GCInspector rewrite in CASSANDRA-7638 the times reported for CMS are the full time (including all the concurrent time), not just the stop the world pause time. In previous versions we reported just the stop the world pause time. This change is kind of scary for someone used to the old logs, and is also not as useful. You can't get "how long were things really stopped" from the log message any more.

For example, this is a CMS that got logged in C* 2.1:

INFO  [Service Thread] 2015-04-03 23:58:37,583  GCInspector.java:142 - ConcurrentMarkSweep GC in 12926ms.  CMS Old Gen: 5305346280 -> 1106799064; Par Eden Space: 223080 -> 158423560; Par Survivor Space: 42081744 -> 51339584

And here is the corresponding information for that CMS from the gc log.

2015-04-03T23:58:24.656+0000: 8064.780: [GC [1 CMS-initial-mark: 5181002K(6901760K)] 5222315K(7639040K), 0.0316710 secs] [Times: user=0.03 sys=0.00, real=0.03 secs] 
2015-04-03T23:58:24.688+0000: 8064.812: Total time for which application threads were stopped: 0.0324490 seconds
2015-04-03T23:58:24.688+0000: 8064.812: [CMS-concurrent-mark-start]
2015-04-03T23:58:26.939+0000: 8067.062: [CMS-concurrent-mark: 2.176/2.250 secs] [Times: user=12.94 sys=1.73, real=2.25 secs] 
2015-04-03T23:58:26.939+0000: 8067.063: [CMS-concurrent-preclean-start]
2015-04-03T23:58:27.209+0000: 8067.333: [CMS-concurrent-preclean: 0.187/0.270 secs] [Times: user=1.53 sys=0.15, real=0.28 secs] 
2015-04-03T23:58:27.210+0000: 8067.333: [CMS-concurrent-abortable-preclean-start]
2015-04-03T23:58:27.988+0000: 8068.112: [CMS-concurrent-abortable-preclean: 0.759/0.779 secs] [Times: user=4.07 sys=0.74, real=0.77 secs] 
2015-04-03T23:58:27.989+0000: 8068.113: [GC[YG occupancy: 488441 K (737280 K)]2015-04-03T23:58:27.989+0000: 8068.113: [Rescan (parallel) , 0.3688960 secs]2015-04-03T23:58:28.358+0000: 8068.482: [weak refs processing, 0.0009620 secs]2015-04-03T23:58:28.359+0000: 8068.483: [class unloading, 0.0060870 secs]2015-04-03T23:58:28.365+0000: 8068.489: [scrub symbol table, 0.0146010 secs]2015-04-03T23:58:28.380+0000: 8068.504: [scrub string table, 0.0031270 secs] [1 CMS-remark: 5231445K(6901760K)] 5719886K(7639040K), 0.3953770 secs] [Times: user=2.96 sys=0.00, real=0.39 secs] 
2015-04-03T23:58:28.385+0000: 8068.508: Total time for which application threads were stopped: 0.3962470 seconds
2015-04-03T23:58:28.385+0000: 8068.509: [CMS-concurrent-sweep-start]
2015-04-03T23:58:37.582+0000: 8077.706: [CMS-concurrent-sweep: 8.661/9.197 secs] [Times: user=44.80 sys=9.58, real=9.20 secs] 
2015-04-03T23:58:37.589+0000: 8077.713: [CMS-concurrent-reset-start]
2015-04-03T23:58:37.633+0000: 8077.757: [CMS-concurrent-reset: 0.044/0.044 secs] [Times: user=0.19 sys=0.10, real=0.04 secs]

The entire CMS took the 12 seconds reported in the GCIspector log message. Previously we would have only reported the 0.39 seconds that were spent in STW pauses.

At the least we need to change the log message so that people don't think we are still just reporting STW time. But it would be more helpful if we could get the STW time and put that into the log message like we had previously.
item.summary: GCInspector logs very different times after CASSANDRA-7638

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Change to address this on github
https://github.com/apache/cassandra/compare/trunk...aweisberg:C-9124?expand=1

Keep accepting the notifications, but use the old method of calculating duration when the notifications fire for GCs that might be partially concurrent.

I will rebase this for 2.1.5 once the design is approved.

One nit: unused import

The list of GCs is consistent with the names mentioned in hotspot/src/share/vm/services/memoryManager.hpp.

You can replace the multiple hash maps (gctimes + beans), collections and sorting and move it all to the GCInspector constructor by introducing a static inner class holding the reference to GarbageCollectorMXBean, the previousTotal and the sorted list of keys. Also take care of calling GcInfo#getMemoryUsageBeforeGc since it always creates an unmodifiable instance of the underlying map.

The comment (full collection) above the call to SSTableDeletingTask.rescheduleFailedTasks() is (hopefully) not true. Can you change that?

In order to track application stopped time (which is not reported by the JMX beans), we could do something like this added to the static initializer of GCInspector.

        Thread stwTracker = new Thread()
        {
            public void run()
            {
                while (true)
                {
                    long t0 = System.nanoTime();
                    try
                    {
                        Thread.sleep(1);
                    }
                    catch (InterruptedException e)
                    {
                        break;
                    }
                    long t1 = System.nanoTime();
                    long t = (t1 - t0) / 1000000;
                    if (t > 1)
                        stwTimeInaccurate.addAndGet(t);
                }
            }
        };
        stwTracker.setDaemon(true);
        stwTracker.setName("GC STW tracker");
        stwTracker.start();

A quick experiment showed that (with ParNew/CMS) that approach works nicely and gives about the same results as -XX:+PrintGCApplicationStoppedTime.

Just a note: during a concurrent collection it might occur that after.getUsed() returns a higher value than before.getUsed(). But unfortunately that GCInfo thing does not provide something like getCollectedBytes(). So we should make that clear by renaming the field State.totalBytesReclaimed.

PS:
I used this code to force a lot of GCs in new+old gen in a 1GB VM:

        new Thread() {
            public void run()
            {
                List<byte[]> l = new ArrayList<>();
                while (true)
                {
                    for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)
                        l.add(new byte[1024]);
                    try
                    {
                        Thread.sleep(250);
                    }
                    catch (InterruptedException e)
                    {
                        e.printStackTrace();
                    }
                    l.clear();
                }
            }
        }.start();
        new Thread() {
            public void run()
            {
                List<byte[]> l = new ArrayList<>();
                while (true)
                {
                    for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++)
                        l.add(new byte[64 * 1024 * 1024]);
                    try
                    {
                        Thread.sleep(250);
                    }
                    catch (InterruptedException e)
                    {
                        e.printStackTrace();
                    }
                    l.clear();
                }
            }
        }.start();

EDIT: all experiments on OSX
any update? Can somebody review and commit the fix?
Robert Stupp reviewed above; waiting for Jeremiah to respond.
Pretty sure we are waiting on aweisberg to fix nits and then it is good? snazy is that right? That is what I got from discussion on IRC the other day.
(My mistake, I misread whose branch was being reviewed.)

jjordan, that's right. We can go with aweisberg's approach (with the nits from my previous comment addressed).

To have some ”better” logging of application-stopped times, which is probably what we really want, I've opened CASSANDRA-9254 since this ticket is "just" to correct the output itself.

Yea - that's what I meant - looks really good.

Just one nit:

  • move the gcInfo.getMemoryUsageBeforeGc() and gcInfo.getMemoryUsageAfterGc() outside the for loop (it always builds a new unmodifiable map instance) - lines #255 + #256

After that it should be ready for commit (will do some testing the next days).
I am not ready to merge it yet. I need to get the GC names for C4 to address the issue rescheduling failed tasks only running after CMS. I will make that change though.

+1 on the latest patch

Committed as 8f2a26c4f109d88a8fc1a41138de1c3d0bf39a05

Tested by tweaking MIN_LOG_DURATION = 0 - logged output LGTM
Zing gc names are "GPGC Old" and "GPGC New" but the GCInspector receives zero notifications under Zing so it is a moot point until that is fixed.
